item.description:
Dialogue for Change featuring the documentary "The Last Mountain"

Discussion with the Producer, Eric Grunebaum and Co-sponsors Framingham Sierra Club and  Transition Framingham

Saturday |  May 19 | 7:00pm

In the valleys of Appalachia, a battle is being fought over a mountain. It is a battle with severe consequences that affect every American, regardless of their social status, economic background or where they live. It is a battle that has taken many lives and continues to do so the longer it is waged. It is a battle over protecting our health and environment from the destructive power of Big Coal.

A passionate and personal tale that honors the extraordinary power of ordinary Americans when they fight for what they believe in, THE LAST MOUNTAIN shines a light on America’s energy needs and how those needs are being supplied. It is a fight for our future that affects us all.

Discussion will follow on the positve next steps for clean energy, community building and resilience.

Note: The location of this event will be at the Hall of the Edwards Church, 39 Edwards Street in Framingham-saxonville.Directions

Watch the Trailer

The donations accepted at this screening will support I Love Mountains (www.ilovemountains.org), a group working to end mountaintop removal coal mining and countering Big Coal's efforts to destroy the mountains we love.
item.name: Conscious Movie May - The Last Mountain
